The Bible: It's all about Jesus...

Most religious institutions are about things people do, or should do, or even more overwhelmingly about things they shouldn't do. The focus is on people. That's why God's business is big business. Many products are created to supposedly bring the believers closer to God. From books, to music, seminars, conferences, training, you name it. The abundance of these things, and the pursuit after them, say one thing: Jesus saved you, but now it's your turn to take it all the way. You've heard about Jesus at an evangelistic meeting, now we, the churches of Jesus Christ, will tell you about yourselves. The focus is now on you.

But the true church of Christ is never meant to be like this. It sets people free to live the lives God planned for them. Its sole purpose is to help folks fix their eyes on Jesus, not on themselves, to fully realize that Jesus died on the cross for them once and never again, that they were made whole to face God without shame, with heads lifted high, and hear the gentle whisper of the Spirit of God that "now there is no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus." (Romans 8:1)

About VACSF

VACSF, Hội Thánh Tin Lành Việt Nam, in San Francisco, is a congregation of believers in Christ from all walks of life who assembles every Sunday to celebrate everlasting life afforded them through the Son of God who came to save the world. Please continue reading for contact, schedules, and other information.

Bible Study

Studies of various common topics, especially those that tend to be misunderstood and hence misapplied. Don't accept anything even from the best of teachers as Scriptures, but be like the Bereans to check whatever you hear or read. Check your own interpretation of a passage against all foundational truths you can possibly know, and you will know beyond any doubt its true meaning. In this section you will find the following studies:
1. Galatians
2. Romans
3. Hot Potatoes Topics

More ›

Church Events

This section documents some special events in the life of our church. Baptism, picnic, camping, retreats, Vacation Bible School, and many others. But like many things that can be captured on camera, they only show superficially the lives of the individuals; their struggles, the unique events in their lives that God uses to build their relationship with Him remain unpsoken. But perhaps these documentaries may serve as landmarks for them in their walk with God.

New Blog Articles

Celebration

40th Anniversary Celebration

Vietnamese Alliance Church in San Francisco celebrated their 40th Anniversary of its founding in 1975. Over decades past, it has been a sanctuary for many; from the service in the sanctuary where hymns of praises were sung and sermons preached, to Sunday School where empowering and liberating truths were discovered and marvelled at, and fellowship over lunch was enjoyed by all.
